There is currently no integration with VTEX
Objective(s) to solve
Integrate all payment methods (Card, Transfer, and Cash)
Be in the VTEX configuration console as a gateway
Justification
Expand the CMS offer
Strengthen functionalities
Risks
It will not allow Kushki to grow safely and sustainably.

"Explain why this functionality is being built and what is expected to be achieved.
It is needed to couple the existing Billing Collections and Ecuador Settlement functionalities and couple them to the new version put into production by International Bank in order to continue using the settlement dashboard service recently put into production in Q1 2022.
Goals
List the goals and objectives to be achieved.
Adapt Ecuador's collection and settlement processes to the new Cash Management of Banco Internacional".

data.C1: 🌎 GL -Repositorio de datos centralizado para Kushki BBD interna transacciones- Fase 1 Dynamo LEDGER
data.C4:
Governance & Compliance
Onboarding
Finanzas & FinOps
Comercial
Riesgos
data.C5:
## Context ##

Currently, transaction information is dispersed in various information sources; it generates differences to obtain data, and with that, reliability is lost. With this background, it is proposed to obtain the necessary data related to the transactionality of merchants, with renamed fields and in a synchronized manner, consolidating them in Dynamo Ledger.

## Objective(s) to solve ##
Avoid redundancy of information sources and functions in areas that handle business transaction data.
Reduce time spent on base crossings and searching transactional information tables.
Avoid data inconsistency presented in reports, dashboards, management reports, reports to regulatory entities, etc.
Apply access and restrictions based on security profiles to this transactional information.
Maintain the integrity and fidelity of the data.
Improve the performance of information extraction with an adequate periodicity, constant purification and distribution.

data.C1: 🇨🇱 CL - Liquidación automática clientes con Banco de Chile
data.C5:
Background
It is required to generate the automation of the settlement process with Banco de Chile corresponding to the transactions generated by card, transfer and cash.
Objectives
    Reduce manual processes to apply the settlements with Banco de Chile, by automating this action.
    Disperse in an orderly and scheduled manner based on the cut-off times established by the banks in each country.
    To have an information panel with the detail of all the records generated to settle and their status.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

data.C4:
Onboarding
PSP
Finanzas & FinOps
Comercial
Partnerships
data.C5:
Scope of this DRP:* *.

For the purposes of this DRP, the entire payment method in general, impacts on processes, consoles, final products and databases will be worked on.

  

h2. Goals

# Enable the new processor (Kushki Processor" = direct connection with banks) for the "Transfer In" payment method in Peru.

data.C1: 🇵🇪 PE - Transfer in Conexión Directa Bancos (BCP)
data.C4:
Onboarding
PSP
Finanzas & FinOps
Comercial
Partnerships
data.C5:
h1. *Objective*.



The objective is to replace Safetypay in the transfer in method for Peru by making a direct integration with the main banks of this country, in this PRD we will work on the direct connection with BCP bank.

h1. Goals

# To integrate the direct connection with BCP for the transfer in payment method.
# Enable merchant configuration of this payment method in the internal console.
# Enable all end products to this payment method with this new road with BCP.
# Automate all operational processes contemplated by the tranfer in payment method (onboarding reconciliation, invoicing, settlement, refunds, among others).

data.C1: 🇵🇪 PE - Transfer in Conexión Directa Bancos (BBVA)
data.C4:
Onboarding
PSP
Finanzas & FinOps
Comercial
Partnerships
data.C5:
We are looking to replace Safetypay in the transfer in method for Peru by making a direct integration with the main banks in this country, in this PRD we will work on the direct connection with BBVA bank.

h1. Justification

h2. Description

There are 3 merchants that will be starting operations in Peru soon for the transfer in payment method. These merchants are Binance, Cryptomarket and Bitpoint. The projections that these merchants shared with us could make the POS and transactions grow considerably in this country. Below are the projections of each of these 3 merchants:

As a result of this business with these 3 merchants, the need arises to improve our road to transfer in payments in Peru, which is why it is required to integrate with major banks in the country. 

For the purposes of this DRP, we will work on the integration with BBVA.

h2. Goals

# To integrate the direct connection with BBVA for the transfer in payment method.
# Enable merchant configuration of this payment method in the internal console.
# Enable all end products to this payment method with this new road with BBVA.
# Automate all operational processes contemplated by the tranfer in payment method (onboarding reconciliation, invoicing, settlement, refunds, among others).

data.C1: 🇪🇨 EC - Reporte transaccional Claro
data.C5:
Context:
Currently a permanent report is generated and sent by mail at 6:00 AM on a transactional basis corresponding to Claro EC under the following parameters:

Objectives:
It is required to automate the generation of transactional report for all Claro Merchants in Ecuador to be sent to the international bank on a scheduled basis.

Goals
    Send automatically and on a daily basis the Card transactional report for Claro Merchant.

Considerations
The hourly cut of the file must contemplate 5 days prior to the sending date from 00:00:00:00 to 23:59:59.999 EC time.
Example: Date of shipment, 05/04/2022 06:00 AM
File time cut-off, 03/31/2022 00:00:00 TO 04/04/2022 23:59:59.999
Risks 
 
    Manual processing may result in erroneous settlement.
    Financial loss due to human error
    Loss of reputation
    Loss of business with the client.

Confluence: https://kushki.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EDP/pages/2799960160/EC+-+Reporting+transactional+Clear

data.C1: 🇨🇴 CO- Brindar los motivos de denegaciones de PSE a los comercios
data.C5:
Context:
Currently PSE sends the Rejection Code in the GetTransactioninformation method, and the field is called autorizationID.

Today the Kushki linked merchants in Colombia do not have a report in console and reporting in which they can identify the code and the reason for the rejection.

Objectives:

    Identify the causes of PSE rejection associated with the codes sent by PSE in the transaction messaging.
    Link the reasons to the codes in a table that allows to deliver it in the console and reporting.
    Homologate PSE codes and causes to an internal coding that allows to deliver to merchants information from both sources (PSE-KUSHKI).

Goals:

To provide merchants with valuable information in the identification of rejection reasons for PSE in Colombia as a means of payment.

Risks
Loss of customers by comparison with other competitors in the market that do provide this information.

PRD: https://kushki.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EDP/pages/2754446631/CO-+C+C+rejection+codes+for+PSE+in+Console.

data.C1: 🇨🇴 CO - Proceso de Conciliación Transaccional VISA
🇨🇴 CO - Proceso de Conciliación Transaccional MASTERCARD
🇨🇴 CO- Modal / Servicio de PSE (Colombia) no disponible.
data.C5:
Context

The transfer processor PSE of Colombia has presented intermittencies, for such reason it is necessary to communicate to the end user to indicate him to try later to make the transaction or to select another means of payment.

*Scope

* Applies to country Colombia
* This logic is for PSE and PSE advances only.
* When the Processor is not available at the moment the user is making a transfer in, the following mockup must be displayed (see image and link) otherwise the current logic must be kept.
